location: The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.

lines.text: Enter certain Outlaws

lines.speaker: first outlaw
lines.text: Fellows, stand fast; I see a passenger.

lines.speaker: second outlaw
lines.text: If there be ten, shrink not, but down with 'em.
Enter VALENTINE and SPEED

lines.speaker: third outlaw
lines.text: Stand, sir, and throw us that you have about ye: If not: we'll make you sit and rifle you.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Sir, we are undone; these are the villains That all the travellers do fear so much.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: My friends,--

lines.speaker: first outlaw
lines.text: That's not so, sir: we are your enemies.

lines.speaker: second outlaw
lines.text: Peace! we'll hear him.

lines.speaker: third outlaw
lines.text: Ay, by my beard, will we, for he's a proper man.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Then know that I have little wealth to lose: A man I am cross'd with adversity; My riches are these poor habiliments, Of which if you should here disfurnish me, You take the sum and substance that I have.

lines.speaker: second outlaw
lines.text: Whither travel you?

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: To Verona.

lines.speaker: first outlaw
lines.text: Whence came you?

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: From Milan.

lines.speaker: third outlaw
lines.text: Have you long sojourned there?

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Some sixteen months, and longer might have stay'd, If crooked fortune had not thwarted me.

lines.speaker: first outlaw
lines.text: What, were you banish'd thence?

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: I was.

lines.speaker: second outlaw
lines.text: For what offence?

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: For that which now torments me to rehearse: I kill'd a man, whose death I much repent; Bu t yet I slew him manfully in fight, Without false vantage or base treachery.

lines.speaker: first outlaw
lines.text: Why, ne'er repent it, if it were done so. But were you banish'd for so small a fault?

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: I was, and held me glad of such a doom.

lines.speaker: second outlaw
lines.text: Have you the tongues?

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: My youthful travel therein made me happy, Or else I often had been miserable.

lines.speaker: third outlaw
lines.text: By the bare scalp of Robin Hood's fat friar, This fellow were a king for our wild faction!

lines.speaker: first outlaw
lines.text: We'll have him. Sirs, a word.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Master, be one of them; it's an honourable kind of thievery.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Peace, villain!

lines.speaker: second outlaw
lines.text: Tell us this: have you any thing to take to?

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Nothing but my fortune.

lines.speaker: third outlaw
lines.text: Know, then, that some of us are gentlemen, Such as the fury of ungovern'd youth Thrust from the company of awful men: Myself was from Verona banished For practising to steal away a lady, An heir, and near allied unto the duke.

lines.speaker: second outlaw
lines.text: And I from Mantua, for a gentleman, Who, in my mood, I stabb'd unto the heart.

lines.speaker: first outlaw
lines.text: And I for such like petty crimes as these, But to the purpose--for we cite our faults, That they may hold excus'd our lawless lives; And partly, seeing you are beautified With goodly shape and by your own report A linguist and a man of such perfection As we do in our quality much want--

lines.speaker: second outlaw
lines.text: Indeed, because you are a banish'd man, Therefore, above the rest, we parley to you: Are you content to be our general? To make a virtue of necessity And live, as we do, in this wilderness?

lines.speaker: third outlaw
lines.text: What say'st thou? wilt thou be of our consort? Say ay, and be the captain of us all: We'll do thee homage and be ruled by thee, Love thee as our commander and our king.

lines.speaker: first outlaw
lines.text: But if thou scorn our courtesy, thou diest.

lines.speaker: second outlaw
lines.text: Thou shalt not live to brag what we have offer'd.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: I take your offer and will live with you, Provided that you do no outrages On silly women or poor passengers.

lines.speaker: third outlaw
lines.text: No, we detest such vile base practises. Come, go with us, we'll bring thee to our crews, And show thee all the treasure we have got, Which, with ourselves, all rest at thy dispose.
Exeunt
